humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that 4 out of 22 (or 20, as two additional nodes were identified in deeper sections) lymph nodes were positive for tumor. This corresponds to the N1 stage, as per Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total). The report also states that 'TUMOR PRESENT OUTSIDE LYMPH BODES', which confirms the presence of metastases in regional lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that four out of twenty-two (4/22) axillary lymph nodes are positive for tumor involvement. This corresponds to an N1 stage, as N1 stage indicates cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes. The additional information about tumor present outside of lymph nodes does not affect the N stage classification.
